page.title: 03MARINE LIFE IN THE FOWEY
page.content: Several species of fish are found in the river when the tide is in. {Salmon}and{sea-trout}swim up the river to spawn.{Bass}swim up the river as far as Golant, and on a rising tide{grey mullet}can be seen in shallow water as far up river as Lerryn. At low water{flounders}and { {plaice,}which are{flat fish,}cover themselves with sand in the shallow water that remains, and these can be speared whilst wading in the river, with fluking irons. { Cockles, ragworms}and{sandeels live under the mud and sand. At low tide people go raking for{cockles}on the sand flats and anglers dig ragworms }for bait. {Mussels}are found on rocks and { {Shore crabs}are plentiful along the shore line.
